item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Firefly ‘Blue Ghost’ lunar lander touches down on the moon (332 points | 84 comments)
2. Made a scroll bar buddy that walks down the page when you scroll (178 points | 88 comments)
3. Solarpunk (251 points | 114 comments)
4. Gooey rubber that's slowly ruining old hard drives (160 points | 96 comments)
5. Yoke: Infrastructure as code, but actually (23 points | 20 comments)
6. Show HN: Tangled – Git collaboration platform built on atproto (23 points | 1 comment)
7. Smallpond – A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (231 points | 50 comments)
8. Blender-made movie Flow takes Oscar (303 points | 36 comments)
9. Speedrunners are vulnerability researchers, they just don't know it yet (243 points | 67 comments)
10. Harvest the sun twice: Agrivoltaics promises sustainable food, energy and water (13 points | 2 comments)
11. Hallucinations in code are the least dangerous form of LLM mistakes (203 points | 147 comments)
12. The Pentium contains a complicated circuit to multiply by three (249 points | 87 comments)
13. A Few of the Birds I Love (36 points | 9 comments)
14. Rackmounting that which should not be rackmounted (16 points | 1 comment)
15. BM25 in PostgreSQL – 3x Faster Than Elasticsearch (36 points | 6 comments)
16. We in-housed our data labelling (13 points | 6 comments)
17. API design note: Beware of adding an "Other" enum value (143 points | 81 comments)
18. Kaspersky exposes hidden malware on GitHub stealing personal data (101 points | 20 comments)
19. Geothermal power is a climate moon shot beneath our feet (196 points | 192 comments)
20. Losing a 5-year-long Illinois FOIA lawsuit for database schemas (59 points | 5 comments)
21. Begrudgingly Choosing CBOR over MessagePack (8 points | 3 comments)
22. Show HN: Prompting LLMs in Bash scripts (50 points | 4 comments)
23. Why do we have both CSRF protection and CORS? (137 points | 77 comments)
24. Matt's Script Archive (1995) (97 points | 42 comments)
25. Ask HN: A question about mentoring a junior developer (19 points | 21 comments)
26. Schools reviving shop class (179 points | 134 comments)
27. Turning my ESP32 into a DNS sinkhole to fight doomscrolling (80 points | 18 comments)
28. Gödel's theorem debunks the most important AI myth – Roger Penrose [video] (111 points | 227 comments)
29. I struggled with Git, so I'm making a game to spare others the pain (158 points | 212 comments)
30. Morphing robot turns challenging terrain to its advantage (16 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
